TermDefinition.DefinitionText: A type of enzyme that causes the transfer of a chemical substance called an amino group from one molecule to another. Transaminases are involved in many processes in the body, such as making amino acids.

SpanishTermDefinition.DefinitionText: Tipo de enzima que provoca la transferencia de una sustancia que se llama grupo amino de una molécula a otra. Las transaminasas participan en muchos procesos corporales, como la elaboración de aminoácidos.
